perturbation.original_text: 2. Covenants Not to Compete. (a) Member specifically acknowledges that, pursuant to the Franchise Agreement, and by virtue of its position with Franchisee, Member will receive valuable specialized training and Confidential Information, including, without limitation, information regarding the operational, sales, promotional, and marketing methods and techniques of Franchisor and the System. (b) Member covenants and agrees that during the term of the Franchise Agreement, except as otherwise approved in writing by Franchisor, Member shall not, either directly or indirectly, for itself, or through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any person, persons, partnership, corporation, or entity: (i) Own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, rent or lease to, or have any other interest in business that (directly or indirectly) operates, or grants franchises or licenses to operate, a restaurant featuring pizza and related food specialties or that offers products or services substantially similar to those then offered by Pizza Fusions Restaurants ("Competitive Business");
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Covenants Not to Compete. (a) Member acknowledges that, pursuant to the Franchise Agreement, and by virtue of its position with Franchisee, Member *might* receive training and Confidential Information, possibly including information regarding the operational, sales, promotional, and marketing methods and techniques of Franchisor and the System. (b) Member covenants and agrees that during the term of the Franchise Agreement, except as otherwise approved in writing by Franchisor, Member shall not, either directly or indirectly, for itself *if such actions are deemed deliberately harmful to the Franchise*, or through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any person, persons, partnership, corporation, or entity: (i) Own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, rent or lease to, or have any other interest in business that (directly or indirectly) operates, or grants franchises or licenses to operate, a restaurant featuring pizza and related food specialties or that offers products or services substantially similar to those then offered by Pizza Fusions Restaurants ("Competitive Business");
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Member *will* receive training and confidential information. The modified text changes this to 'might' receive, creating uncertainty about the basis for the non-compete clause. Further, it limits the non-compete to instances of 'deliberately harmful' actions, contrasting with the strict prohibition in the original text. This introduces ambiguity regarding the scope and enforceability of the non-compete agreement, creating potential for dispute.

perturbation.original_text: (d) As used in this Agreement, the term "Post-Term Period" shall mean a continuous uninterrupted period of two (2) years from the date of: (a) a transfer permitted under Section 14 of the Franchise Agreement; (b) expiration or termination of the Franchise Agreement (regardless of the cause for termination); (c) termination of Member's employment with Franchisee; and/or (d) a final order of a duly authorized arbitrator, panel of arbitrators, or a court of competent jurisdiction (after all appeals have been taken) with respect to any of the foregoing or with respect to the enforcement of this Agreement; either directly or indirectly (through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any persons, partnership, corporation or entity).
perturbation.changed_text: (d) As used in this Agreement, the term "Post-Term Period" shall mean a continuous uninterrupted period of two (2) years from the date of: (a) a transfer permitted under Section 14 of the Franchise Agreement *unless otherwise agreed upon by the Franchisor in writing*; (b) expiration or termination of the Franchise Agreement (regardless of the cause for termination) *except in cases of franchisee's severe misconduct*; (c) termination of Member's employment with Franchisee; and/or (d) a final order of a duly authorized arbitrator, panel of arbitrators, or a court of competent jurisdiction (after all appeals have been taken) with respect to any of the foregoing or with respect to the enforcement of this Agreement; either directly or indirectly (through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any persons, partnership, corporation or entity).
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces exceptions to the definition of 'Post-Term Period,' creating uncertainty about its duration and applicability. The original text defines it as a fixed two-year period, whereas the modified text allows for variations based on Franchisor's written agreement or in cases of franchisee misconduct. This creates a contradiction by making the Post-Term Period conditional rather than absolute, affecting the enforceability of non-compete obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 6. Third-Party Beneficiary. Member hereby acknowledges and agrees that Franchisor is an intended third-party beneficiary of this Agreement with the right to enforce it, independently or jointly with Franchisee.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. Third-Party Beneficiary. Member hereby acknowledges and agrees that Franchisor *may be considered* an intended third-party beneficiary of this Agreement *under certain circumstances*, with the right to enforce it, independently or jointly with Franchisee. *The specifics of such enforcement are subject to further clarification and mutual agreement between the Franchisor and Franchisee.*
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Franchisor is a third-party beneficiary. The modified text weakens this by stating that the Franchisor 'may be considered' a third-party beneficiary 'under certain circumstances.' The added sentence regarding 'further clarification' and 'mutual agreement' introduces further ambiguity and contradicts the original firm statement of beneficiary status, thus undermining the Franchisor's explicit enforcement rights.
